posts.name: Jasmine Xu

posts.cooked:
Make sure driver station detects your controller in port 0 and port 1

I would print the joystick output to make sure.

posts.name: Jasmine Xu
posts.cooked: The controller has been detected. We also printed the joystick output. Everything seems to be in good condition and in order but the robot is still unresponsive.

posts.name: Isaac
posts.cooked: What kind of motors are you using? PWMVictorSPX might not be the correct class.

posts.name: sam liu
posts.cooked:
您好像用了两个单独的xbox手柄来控制机器人，建议用两个Joystick或者一个xbox手柄的上的两个轴控制。然后您可以试着在代码里加一行

然后在smart dashboard中查看是否有数值 如果手柄有读数但电机没反应，可以打开pheonix tuner尝试直接旋转电机

posts.name: Jared Van Horn
posts.cooked:
I think this is what catrix just said but you are creating two Xbox controllers and controlling the drivetrain with a joystick from each controller.

I would change your code to this instead:

That will make it to where the drivetrain is controlled by one controller instead of being split between two separate controllers.

posts.name: Jasmine Xu
posts.cooked: Thanks. But after we changed the code, it still didn’t work.

posts.name: Jasmine Xu
posts.cooked: 谢谢，不过我们更改代码之后，还是跑不起来。

posts.name: Isaac
posts.cooked:
You shouldn’t need phoenix 5 to run this code.

have you tried spinning the motors in the code with .set()?

posts.name: May
posts.cooked:
It’s VictorSPX, but not should be CAN not PWM .

And when trying to “import com.ctre.phoenix.motorcontrol.can.VictorSPX;”, it says"The import com.ctre cannot be resolved".

Any suggestion to fix this problem would be appriciated~~~

posts.name: May
posts.cooked:
acutally, yes, the code can be built successfully without phoenix 5. json, and failed with phoenix 5.json~~ but why there is no need to have phoenix 5.json to run this code~~~

cuz the VictorSPXs are all in phoenix 5, that’s why we install the phoenix 5~~~

Please do help correct any wrong understandings~~~ Many thanks~~~~

posts.name: Isaac
posts.cooked:
The PWMVictorSPX class is part of the WPILib, not part of CTRE /Phoenix library, so you dont need Phoenix libary for using the PWMVictorSPX class.

For Victor SPX, you will need Phoenix. Try follow the direction of this page and get both Phoenix 6 and phoenix 5. And you probably want to use the WPI_VictorSPX class to work with WPI’s Differential Drive.

Java/C++ Offline Download the Phoenix Framework Installer, Navigate through the installer, ensuring applicable options are selected. Showing the installation screen root Apply the vendordep via WPI...

CAN Drivetrain example Java

posts.name: May
posts.cooked:
Awesome!!! Problem fixed!!! Many thanks!!!

One quick question: why both Phoenix 5&6 need to be installed instead of only phoenix 5~~~~

posts.name: Isaac
posts.cooked: Not exactly sure. I assume it has something to do with many classes are migrated to Phoenix 6, so both is required to ensure backward compatibility?

posts.name: sam liu
posts.cooked: Sorry for my mistake on the previous reply, the vendordeps of pheonix 5 requires the installation of pheonix 6 library or there will be a gradle error.
